text:
Created attachment 23079
error output

This machine was able to build and run apache perfectly till 2.2.9 then with 2.2.10 and now also 2.2.11 there is no way to make it build because this file from apr-utils (apr_dbd_odbc.c) spits out an immense amount of errors and blocks everything else from build. This is a MIPS machine which a rather old version of gcc because there are no newer version compatible with this particular machine (the patches need to be updated manually as gcc doesn't support it directly) this makes it necessary the use of 3.0.3 which is actually the most updated gcc for that machine.

Attached there are the errors output by gcc and the configure log
creator: weltall2@gmail.com
bojan@rexursive.com
text: Have you tried building with --with-odbc=no given to configure? Looks like your ODBC config isn't complete, so the compilation fails (looks to me like not all headers are there).

It seems that option made it possible to complete apache building process successfully. Shouldn't configure detect this problem and act properly?

Thanks very much for the help
creator: weltall2@gmail.com
bojan@rexursive.com
text: We detect some things, but sometimes the installation of required software is incomplete, which then renders detection useless after all.

creator: bojan@rexursive.com
text: Just out of curiosity, do you have sqltypes.h (or something that defines SQLLEN) on the system? Knowing other details of your ODBC installation (version etc.) would also help.
yes I've an sqltypes.h in my system under /usr/include/sqltypes.h which defines also that. It says version 3.51 but I'm unsure if that's correct so I've included it
creator: weltall2@gmail.com
bojan@rexursive.com
text:
That's the problem. SQLLEN is not defined in that file. That's the reason compilation failed (or at least one of them).

Could you upgrade your unixODBC to the latest and then try again?

creator: bojan@rexursive.com
text: Please reopen if this is still a problem.
